In an era not known for its realism, there was a handful of exciting action films firmly rooted in the reality of Hong Kong in the 1970s and bucking the kung-fu and comedy crazes sweeping the movie industry. The ensuing manhunt is one of the most exciting to ever appear on the Hong Kong screen, and named by critics as a highpoint in the career of director Kuei Chih-hung.

Part 1 : 'Gun Snatchers' - Two criminals wanted for murder are turned in by one of their own. 
Part 2: 'Arson' - A Triad revenge plan to burn down a nightclub goes wrong and results in the deaths of five people.
